resources.string: A power nap will boost your memory, cognitive skills, creativity, and energy level.
Ideal for a boost in alertness and energy. This length limits you to the lighter stages of non-rapid eye movement (NREM) sleep, making it easier to hit the ground running after waking up.
This nap is best for improvement in remembering facts, faces and names. It includes slow-wave sleep, the deepest type. The downside: some grogginess upon waking up.

This is a full cycle of sleep, meaning the lighter and deeper stages, including REM (Rapid Eye Movement). This leads to improved emotional and procedural memory and creativity. A nap of this length tipically avoids sleep inertia, making it easier to wake up.

A quick coffee nap is an incredible way to boost energy and productivity. You drink a cup of your favorite coffee, then immediately take a snooze. That short nap will clear Adenosine (what makes you feel drowsy) from your brain for the caffeine to kick in. Like a welcome mat for your coffee.
